projects.title: AI Developer (m/f/d), focus on healthcare
projects.description: For our client - a leading company in the healthcare sector - we are looking for an experienced AI Developer (m/f/d) to join the existing AI team. You will actively work on the digital transformation and develop data-based predictive models to optimize internal processes and quality of care together with the corporate management and specialist departments. The team is responsible for the entire life cycle of the AI applications - from conception and development in Python through to deployment and...
skills: Must-have criteria (A criteria): University degree in a STEM subject (mathematics, computer science, natural sciences, technology). At least 3 years of professional experience in productive data science/data analytics projects: specialized knowledge in individual data science fields (e.g. NLP, OCR etc.). At least 2 years of experience in developing applications in Python. SHI industry expertise through project assignment: You have relevant experience in the area of statutory health insurance (SHI). Additional must-have criteria (A-criteria - as many as possible, not all necessary): AI-supported analysis of applications for medical aids: Experience in predicting approval probabilities and expected control revenue for dark processing and prioritization of applications. In addition, the provision and ML-Ops support of such machine learning models in an HTTP REST service. AI-supported detection of conspicuous prescription behavior: Experience in the analysis of outpatient practices in the areas of medical aids, remedies and hospitals for benchmarking of practitioners and for operational support of practice supervisors with prescription data. Development and optimization of machine learning models based on SHI billing data: For predicting the probability of initial diagnoses or the progression of diseases to address insured persons with regard to prevention and benefit management measures. AI-supported auditing of hospital invoices: Experience in predicting the expected steering revenue when the bill is audited by the Medical Service of the health insurance funds. In addition, the provision and ML-Ops support of such machine learning models in a productive REST service. Nice-to-have criteria (B-criteria): Advanced knowledge of data analysis and visualization in Python. In-depth knowledge of SQL. Deep understanding of the full ML lifecycle: from data extraction to modeling, product development and A/B testing. Experience in working according to DevOps principles: Familiarity with industry best deployment practices using CI/CD tools (e.g. Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes).

projects.title: AI Specialist (m/f/d) Machine Learning, Focus Healthcare, 100% Remote
projects.description: We are looking for AI Developers (m/f/d) to join the AI Center and actively shape the digital transformation of a leading healthcare company. Together with the corporate management and specialist departments, our client develops pioneering AI solutions. They use both classic statistical learning methods and the latest technologies in generative AI and large language models (LLMs). They accompany the entire life cycle of the applications - from conception and development in Python to deployment and...
skills: Must-have criteria (A criteria) Sound IT knowledge: Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, OOP, testing, complexity and its impact on software design. Python expertise: At least 3 years of experience in software development with Python - incl. full-stack, app or distributed systems. AI/data project experience: At least 1 year of active involvement in productive AI, data science or analytics projects, incl. specialization (e.g. NLP, OCR). SHI experience: Proven project experience in the statutory health insurance environment. SHI-relevant AI project experience in at least one area: AI-supported processing and analysis of benefit statements (OCR, XML, LLMs) Development of an AI-based knowledge management system (e.g. with RAG, semantic search) LLM-supported evaluation of appeals and administrative files Nice-to-have criteria (B criteria) Complete ML lifecycle: Experience from data preparation to A/B tests Statistics & ML: Sound knowledge of common procedures and algorithms Big Data & Databases: Knowledge of Spark, BigQuery, Hadoop or similar technologies as well as handling various databases. Confident handling of data processing, visualization and modeling in Python: Supplemented by sound SQL knowledge. Practical experience with cloud computing platforms: MS Azure, AWS or GCP in particular. Familiarity with DevSecOps principles and CI/CD tools: Experience with industry best deployment practices (e.g. Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform) and infrastructure as code. Experience in prompt engineering for LLMs: knowledge of using techniques to provide application-specific information for LLMs, such as Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG). Experience in using modern software libraries: especially LangChain to develop workflows and systems based on LLMs.
